record.description: In the defense group sponsored by Pulse Magazine are (left to right) Lois Regnell, Betty Headlin, Fay Trolander and Frances Megan. The University of Chicago's student magazine, Pulse, announced today that it will sponsor a women's defense group for co-eds, and suggested editorially that the nation's defense program include a six-month intensive training course for unmarried women without dependents. The last war has shown the place of women in the war society is an important one, the editorial said. Jobs which must be vacated by men drafted into the army, home defense occupations of various sorts, ambulance and hospital corps must all be maintained.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Attached caption and crop and paint marks on the surface.
